t: The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
Hear,*pn you peoples, all of you; pay*ld attention, O earth, and all that is in it, and*ln let the Lord God*s be a witness against you, the*ld Lord from his holy temple.
For*ln behold, the Lord*s is coming out of his place, and*ld will come down and tread upon the high places of the earth.
And*ln the mountains will melt under him, and*ld the valleys will split open, like*ln wax before the fire, like*ld waters poured down a steep place.

All*ln this is for the transgression of Jacob and*ld for the sins of the house of Israel. What*ln is the transgression of Jacob? Is*ld it not Samaria? And*ln what is the high place of Judah? Is*ld it not Jerusalem?
Therefore*ln I will make Samaria a heap in the open country, a*ld place for planting vineyards, and*ln I will pour down her stones into the valley and*ld uncover her foundations.

All*ln her carved images shall be beaten to pieces, all*ld her wages shall be burned with fire, and*ld all her idols I will lay waste, for*ln from the fee of a prostitute she gathered them, and*ld to the fee of a prostitute they shall return.
For*pn this I will lament and wail; I*ld will go stripped and naked; I*ln will make lamentation like the jackals, and*ld mourning like the ostriches.
For*ln her wound is incurable, and*ld it has come to Judah; it*ln has reached to the gate of my people, to*ld Jerusalem.
Tell*pn it not in Gath; weep*ld not at all; in*ln Beth-le-aphrah roll*ld yourselves in the dust.

Pass*ln on your way, inhabitants*ld of Shaphir, in*ld nakedness and shame; the*ln inhabitants of Zaanan do*ld not come out; the*ln lamentation of Beth-ezel shall*ld take away from you its standing place.
For*ln the inhabitants of Maroth wait*ld anxiously for good, because*ln disaster has come down from the Lord*s to*ld the gate of Jerusalem.
Harness*ln the steeds to the chariots, inhabitants*ld of Lachish; it*ln was the beginning of sin to*ld the daughter of Zion, for*ln in you were found the*ld transgressions of Israel.
Therefore*ln you shall give parting gifts to*ld Moresheth-gath; the*ln houses of Achzib shall be a deceitful thing to*ld the kings of Israel.
I*ln will again bring a conqueror to you, inhabitants*ld of Mareshah; the*ln glory of Israel shall*ld come to Adullam.
Make*ln yourselves bald and cut off your hair, for*ld the children of your delight; make*ln yourselves as bald as the eagle, for*ld they shall go from you into exile.
